alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Rawlins; Sherman; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 11:45PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Cheyenne, western Thomas, western Rawlins and eastern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, southwestern Hitchcock and southeastern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska through 1130 PM MDT/1230 AM CDT/... At 1044 PM MDT/1144 PM CDT/, trained weather spotters reported strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northwest of McDonald to 11 miles west of Winona. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters and NWS employee observed pea sized hail in Goodland, KS. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of eastern Cheyenne, western Thomas, western Rawlins and eastern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, southwestern Hitchcock and southeastern Dundy Counties in southwestern Nebraska, including the following locations... Blakeman and Beardsley. This includes Interstate 70 in Kansas between mile markers 28 and 53. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
